text:
Candidate N o.:  61307  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS   
                                         
Location:    UK 
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Feb 2020 – May 2020 Most Recent Company  
Tech start up focusing on OT cyber security . 
Position: Sales Director UK&I  
Joined the company to take over responsibility for manager large accounts in the UK & Ireland territory. He 
underwent significant detailed training in IT -OT security and customer strategy etc. with commendations by 
Management. Shortly after he joined, the compa ny was acquired by a Fortune 500  company  and they announced 
a series of redundancies across the field sales team in EMEA and unfortunately,  he was a victim of this redundancy.  
 
2016 – 2020  Previous Company   
Leaders in cloud security solutions.  
Position: Regional Sal  
  
Candidate N o.:  61307  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS   
                                         
Location:    UK 
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Feb 2020 – May 2020 Most Recent Company  
Tech start up focusing on OT cyber security . 
Position: Sales Director UK&I  
Joined the company to take over responsibility for manager large accounts in the UK & Ireland territory. He 
underwent significant detailed training in IT -OT security and customer strategy etc. with commendations by 
Management. Shortly after he joined, the compa ny was acquired by a Fortune 500  company  and they announced 
a series of redundancies across the field sales team in EMEA and unfortunately,  he was a victim of this redundancy.  
 
2016 – 2020  Previous Company   
Leaders in cloud security solutions.  
Position: Regional Sales Manager UK&I, Large Enterprise  
His r ole was ‘Direct Touch’ and focuse d on selling into ‘new logo’ large enterprise (10,000 -65,000 users) named 
accounts. Then managing and upselling to existing accounts (UK&I based headquarters but accounts most 
accounts are global).  
 
The company operates a 100% channel model, working mainly with the largest Internet Service Providers and 
Managed Security Services Partners including Verizon, BT, AT&T, Vodafone, T -Systems and VARs including 
Computacenter, Atos etc.  
 
Success was achieved by directly targeting and eng aging end -users. Developing strong relationships with key end -
user stakeholders at all levels. Also, working jointly with partners to build transformation propositions that include 
the company’s  cloud -based security solutions.  
 
Key Achievements:  
• FY2019   177%  
• FY2018   238%  
 
Key Awards include:  
• RSM UK&I Award for Q1 FY17 (Aug -Oct) Building Pipeline  
• EMEA RSM Award for Q1 FY18 (Aug -Oct) 310% achievement  
• EMEA Gold Standard Award Winner 2018 (plus 7,500 RSUs issued for outstanding contribut ions)  
• Global RSM of the QTR for Q4 FY19 (May -July) 257% achievement  
• EMEA RSM for FY19 177% achievement  
 
Significant wins include:  
Global Oil & Gas    $6.5M, 65,000 -100,000 users, 3 years  
Global Utility     $1M, 15,000 users (UK), 3 years  
Global Engineering  Services   $1.5M, 14,500 users, 3 years  
Global Tobacco Manufacturer   $1.5M, 41,000 users, 3 year  
Global Food & Beverages   $450K, 25,000 users, 1 year  
 Publishing & Information Services  $690K, 8,500 users, 3 years  
Leading Construction    $650K 15,000 users, 3  years  
UK Utility     $154K, 6,000 users, 1 year  
Global Designer Retail    $630K, 10,000 users, 3 years  
 
2013 – 2016 Arbor Networks  
Position: Enterprise Sales Manager UK&I  
New role to build and develop pipeline for Arbor’s Enterprise product range (new), and build/re -build channel 
relationships – Arbor has changed from a direct -sales model to 100% channel organisation (for fulfilment). Direct 
selling involvement in 100% of d eals.  
 
Very successfully built strong, proactive relationships with key UK&I security partners including BT, NTT Com 
Security (Integralis), SecureData, Nebulas, Phoenix, Agile Networks, Brookcourt  and have contacts in many more. 
He built a very healthy new  business Enterprise pipeline with large enterprises in banking, finance, insurance, 
pharmaceutical and e -commerce.  
 
Significant Enterprise wins included:  
VISA Europe    $1M  EBRD     $190K  
Prudential (PGDS)   $430K   Trader Media    $260K  
Booking.Com (Pricelin e)  $330K   Rightmove    $120K  
Bank of America   $310K   Colt (internal)    $300K  
GSK     $285K   Baillie Gifford    $120K  
Foreign & Commonwealth  $100K  
 
2011 – 2013 HP – ESS  
Position: Client Engagement Director (New Logo Business & Major Accounts)  
 
Highlights New Logo Wins:  
Tier-1 mobile provider    $3M Support plus $1M+ incremental new business  
Finance payment processor   $1M Phase 1 Technology & Services IDS Project  
Leading foreign exchange   $1M+ business taking over a ‘Red -Flag’ account  
Vodafone Ac count Manager (prior to leaving I was asked to manage Vodafone – KEY Global HP account)    
 
Feb 2010 – Mar 2011 I nfoblox  
Position: Major Account Manager  
Significant wins included Global Telecoms $250K, Global travel e -commerce $300K  
 
2006 – 2010 Fortinet  
Position: Major Account Manager – Direct Touch  
Primary focus on service providers and large enterprise (excluding finance). Identify, develop , and manage high -
value opportunities and projects. Engage with the Fortinet channel as and when appropriate. Key  clients included 
mobile providers, MSSPs (including managed hosting), and a selection of large enterprises. Account base included 
a mixture of new and existing accounts, mostly new.  
 
Sales Achievement Summary : 
• Q3-Q406  105% of target (YTD)  
• 2007 -2008  91% of target  
• 2008 -2009  86% of target  
• Won ‘Best Newcomer Award’ at the December 2006 EMEA Kick -Off event.  
• Closed Fortinet’s first deal globally with a well -known mobile operator in conjunction with a large systems 
integrator (the first global de al with the MO, and 2nd globally with the SI).  
• Secured a global contract to supply security solutions for a (new) large enterprise client (leading market 
research organisation) to deliver perimeter security solutions (FW, VPN, AV & URL) to over 150 sites.  Total 
value in excess of $1,000,000 to Fortinet . 
  
1999 – 2006 Integralis  
Integralis was Europe’s leading specialist provider of network and information security solutions. Reselling market 
leading, best -of-breed security solutions and Integralis’ own ser vices – managed services (FWs, IDS/IPS, e -mail 
and web content etc), support services, and a full range of professional services.  
 
2003 – 2006  
Position: Major Account Manager ( External)  
 
1999  – 2003   
Position: Regional Account Manager ( External)  
 
His role was to sell the full range of solutions and services into named accounts (sub 20 existing and target) with 
an emphasis on high margin services (OTE based on margin). His role included proactive account management 
and account development. He aimed to i dentify the key players within each account, at many levels both commercial 
and technical, to enable him to qualify the need for their services and solutions. It was also a very important aspect 
of the role to create demand/need wherever possible. In every  case it was his aim to become the incumbent security 
partner. My clients included ISPs, mobile operators, utilities , and others.   
 
Achievement Summary : 
1999 -2000  128% of OTE  
2001 -2002  146% of OTE  
2002 -2003  145% of OTE  Sales Achievement Award 2003 (rank ed 1st)  
2003 -2004  150% of OTE  
2004 -2005  119% of OTE  (£653,544 achieved margin / £550,000 target)  
2005 -2006  138% of OTE  (£793,506 achieved margin / £575,000 target)   
2006 Q1/Q2  >95% of OTE  (£507,500 achieved margin YTD / £530,000 target**)  
 
• Developed 3 of Integralis’ top 15 spending accounts. Top account is ranked 3rd highest spending.  
• In 2003/2004, he sold Integralis’ largest (at the time) global managed firewall solution to a utilities organisation  
with a f irst-year value in excess of £750,000.   
 
Key Accounts Sales History : 
• Tier-1 ISP, Tier -1 mobile provider, Global finance investment organisation, Global Pharmaceutical, Tier -1 Utility 
(elec tricity ), International corporate services organisation, Tier -1 betting organisation, Tier -1 Utility (elec).  
 
1997  – 1999  Ouza  
Ouza (Racal -Integralis) a joint venture between Integralis and Racal Telecom – an ISP with a best -of-breed security 
solution portfolio.  
 
1998 – 1999  
Position: Account Manager ( External)  
Within a few months he was promoted to external account manager. The objective of this role was to build and 
manage new and existing relationships.       
 
1997  – 1998   
Position: Telesales ( Internal)  
His first role was proactive telesales  which entailed cold calling prospects, t ypically 500 seats minimum to multi -
nationals, from numerous information sources. His aim was t o identify and close opportunities found over the phone 
and build the accounts over time.  
 
 
Achievement Summary : 
• Sold first managed firewall service to a global insurance organisation (13 global sites). First phase value more 
than £500,000.  
  
1988 – 1997 Euroquipment   
 
1993  – 1997   
Position: Sales Manager  
 
1988  – 1993   
Position: External Sales  
 
1985  – 1988  
Position: Technical Sales   
 
 
COMMENT  
 
A successful, positive, conscientious , and ambitious individual with a competitive edge. He enjoy s working with 
people on many levels – building relationships and meeting new people. He has  a proven track record, over 23 
years, in selling security solutions,  products and services across most verticals including energy (utilities, oil & gas), 
service providers, finance, insurance, enterprise, gaming, services, manufacturing and pharmaceuticals.  
 
He enjoy s most sports and keeping fit. He regularly play s touch r ugby, 5 -a-side football, golf and enjoy s cycling and 
going to the gym. Skiing when possible!  
  
Personal Motivations:  
 
His primary motivation is to succeed financially. He relish es a challenge and enjoy s being succes
